subtitle: Great for a buffet or bonfire party.

method.text: Grill sausages for 8-10 min, turning constantly until cooked.

Meanwhile, place the sugar, vinegar, soy sauce and tomato ketchup into a saucepan and heat gently until sugar has melted. Stir in the pineapple and pepper and cook for 3 min. Remove from heat and leave to cool.
Place the butter and water in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Remove from heat. Tip in the flour all at once and beat together with a wooden spoon.
Return to heat and cook gently, stirring constantly, until mixture comes away from sides of the pan. Leave to cool slightly.
Beat together the eggs, egg yolk and mustard. Add the egg mixture to the pan, a little at a time, until you have a glossy spoonable mixture. Then beat in the cheese and seasoning to taste.
Finely chop the sausages and add to the pan with the salad onions and mix thoroughly.
Heat the oil in a deep fat fryer or large saucepan to 180°C / 350F. Drop tablespoonfuls of the mixture into the oil and deep fry for 3-5 min until crisp and golden.
Drain well on kitchen paper and repeat with remaining mixture, keeping cooked fritters warm.
Finally stir the sweet and sour mixture into the mayonnaise. Season to taste. Serve immediately with fritters.

title: Savoury fritters with sweet and sour dip
